_header: Hail blessed Lady the Mother of Christ Jesu
Note: Initial letters of first five lines, stanzas 15-17, read M-A-R-I-A.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, hymns to; hymns, to Virgin Mary; acrostics
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Ave Iesse Virgula’ — nineteen 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with this refrain

CamTCC601.First Lines:
hayle blyssyd lady the modyr of cryst IhesuOf pease and concorde
                    hayle fresshest on lyue…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Releue all tho by thy mercyfull puruyaunceThat syng of hole
                    hert O Aue Jesse virgula

BLHar2251.First Lines:
HAile blissed lady the moder of crist JhesuOf pees and concorde
                    haile fresshest on lyve…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Releve al tho be thy merciful purviaunceThat syng of hole
                    hert o Ave Iesse virgula
